embeds.title: Time Bomb
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 14 (18) damage to ALL enemies.
**Accelerate** ALL cards in Stasis.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: very stronk
outclasses every other AoE card Guardian has, other than giga beam
2-energy AoE cards are generally strong to begin with, as multi-enemy fights become so much easier to deal with
but on top of that, you also accelerate every card in stasis, which is great for comboing effects and for controlling when a card leaves stasis
not something any other accelerate card can do unconditionally, because they only target the frontmost stasis card

also this is probably the best accelerate card to pair with Shield Charger, as spending 2 energy on offense can often leave you vulnerable to attack, so using another 10 block from it isn't actually a waste most of the time
finally, this card is bugged right now, in such a way that in most scenarios, damage modifiers affect it twice (e.g. strength, vulnerable, and weaken), meaning that it sometimes does absurd damage
<?show10 guardian damage to ALL enemies>

messages.content: so there's guardian whirl, multi-beam (aka whirlwind), giga beam, and also guardian whirl but boss
roll attack barely counts
oop giga beam, gotta amend my statement
whirl is often awkward to play because of needing block though it works better on guardian with defensive mode, has high ceiling though due to 4 hits
multi-beam is ok. that's really all I can say about it.
giga beam carries early game super hard if you can get it though
Especially if you can nab debuff removal to counter its turn loss
Tbh I don't take it often, but it seems good

This is now a pretty OK card to take in the early half of Act 1 if you are desperate for something to clear early fights so you can snowball up to your infinite. It has the notable advantage of at least exhausting itself out of your deck after you play it once. The accelerate thing is basically flavor text, or maybe a tiny nice bonus. Easy skip in act 2+.
certainly a lot better than its previous incarnation
can be used to set up very big turns with lots of stasis slots
I usually play on low ascension (<=5) so I don't need to try very hard to survive act 1, so I just never pick this
so that's why you can afford to be so infinite-crazy

Pretty solid AOE tool, the damage is good, but not amazing, upgrading it is very helpful to increase its damage and clear some minions more easily. Accelerating all cards is very unique, and can do some really impressive things, often allowing you to play 1-2 extra 0 cost cards on the same turn that you play time bomb, and freeing up space to put new cards into stasis. Since it accelerates so many cards, this can be a good enabler of some of the 0 cost synergies like stasis engine or floating orbs. 

It's not like collector struggles with AOE options, you have several and they are all relatively serviceable, with roll attack being a very common act 1 pickup to saturate damage, and multi-beam+ being a very useful card to work with 0 cost synergies, put into stasis, and saturate damage. Giga beam is also very powerful for short hallway fights, and can be strong outside of them if you find debuff removal to negate the drawback. Against those other cards, time bomb's main draw is the acceleration, which is quite powerful, as many guardian strategies involve heavy stasis setup and spam. I'm happy to have one, but I probably won't take it if I already have 2 other good AOE options, and I do generally prefer multi-beam when I can get it, as guardian can struggle with converting their energy into damage sometimes.

The only real issue is that if you draw this too early in a fight, you may not get full value out of the acceleration effect. It's definitely lackluster if you only have 1 card in stasis, but this isn't much of a problem, as you often will have more, and you can draft cards like planning, orb support, or sentry blast higher to compensate. Gets much more powerful if you have one of the ways to gain more stasis slots, as it can bring even more cards back out and lead to really explosive turns. Very handy in act 1, and excellent in act 2 to cover your elite fights, doesn't even fall of that hard in the later acts since the acceleration speeds up your engine.

~~uhhhh~~
~~this isn't collector~~

Gets better once you have 4 energy so that you can play powers and block more easily on the same turn you cast it. Plays well with runic pyramid to accelerate on the best possible turn. Very powerful with necronomicon to double the damage and acceleration.
